original: Bokr faas Skaal
string: 斯卡尔风味食谱

original:
[pagebreak]

Bokr Faas Skaal By Frea of the Skaal

[pagebreak]

Skaal-Style Horker Fat Mac & Cheese with Mudcrab Meat A true Skaal warrior's mac and cheese, made with rich horker fat, hearty Eidar and Goat Cheese, and freshly caught mudcrab meat from the northern shores. Perfect for warming the soul after a long hunt in the icy tundra! Base Ingredients: 1 block of Eidar Cheese (2 cups shredded sharp cheddar or aged gouda for richness) 1 wedge of Goat Cheese (1 cup crumbled goat cheese for tangy depth) *1 chunk of Mammoth Cheese (if available! Otherwise, use smoked gouda or Gruy�re for a smoky note) 1 flagon of Milk (2 cups whole milk or heavy cream for creamy texture) 1 sack of Flour (2 tbsp flour for thickening sauce) 2 tbsp Horker Fat (used instead of butter for a true Skaal flavor!) 1 pinch of Frost Salts (1/2 tsp smoked sea salt for that icy tundra essence!) 1 dash of Fire Salts (1/4 tsp cayenne or smoked paprika for a warming contrast) *1/2 tsp Juniper Berries (adds a hint of wild Skyrim flavor, optional!) *1/2 tsp Ground Garlic (harvested from Riften's farms!) The Mudcrab Addition: 1 whole cooked Mudcrab (Do not forget the remove the shell or it will be crunchy!) 1 tbsp Horker Fat (to saut� the Mudcrab meat!) 1 dash of Nord Pepper Blend (black pepper and a hint of dried thyme!) Topping (For a True Skaal Feast!): *1 cup toasted Stale Bread Crumbs (from Hearthfire home-baked loaves!) 1 tbsp melted Horker Fat (to coat the breadcrumbs for a rustic, crunchy top!) *1 sprinkle of Goat Cheese Crumbles (for extra bite!) 1 pinch of Smoked Snowberry Powder (smoked paprika for color!) Directions - A Feast Worthy of the Skaal 1. Cook the Pasta ('Noodles of the North') Bring a cauldron of salted water to a rolling boil over the campfire. Cook Nordic-style pasta (elbow macaroni, dumpling-style pasta, or flat noodles from an East Empire trader). Drain and set aside in a warm pot. 2. Prepare the Mudcrab Meat Melt horker fat in a pan over medium heat. Toss in the mudcrab meat, seasoning with Nord Pepper Blend and a pinch of Fire Salts. Saut� for 2-3 minutes, just until warmed and lightly golden. Set aside. 3. Make the Cheese Sauce In a sturdy iron pot, melt 2 tbsp horker fat over medium heat. Stir in flour to create a roux, cooking until golden and fragrant (like roasted wheat). Slowly add milk, whisking constantly until smooth. Stir in salt, fire salts, ground garlic, and juniper berries. Bring to a gentle simmer, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and gradually melt in the cheeses (Eidar, Goat Cheese, and Mammoth Cheese) until smooth and creamy. 4. Combine and Assemble Stir the cooked pasta into the cheese sauce until well coated. Gently fold in the Mudcrab meat, ensuring even distribution. 5. Add the Crispy Horker Topping (Skaal Approved!) Preheat the oven (or your Hearthfire home cooking pit) to 375�F (190�C). Pour the mac and cheese into a buttered Nordic baking dish. Mix stale bread crumbs, melted horker fat, goat cheese crumbles, and smoked snowberry powder in a bowl. Sprinkle generously over the top. Bake for 15 minutes until the topping is golden and crisp. 6. Feast Like a True Skaal! Serve hot with a tankard of Honningbrew Mead or Spiced Nordic Wine. Garnish with a sprig of fresh juniper or a few crushed snowberries.
string:
[pagebreak]

斯卡尔风味食谱 作者 斯卡尔村的芙瑞雅

[pagebreak]

斯卡尔风味海象油泥蟹奶酪通心粉 真正的斯卡尔战士通心粉奶酪，以浓香霍克脂、醇厚伊达尔山羊奶酪与北境海岸现捕泥蟹肉制成。冰原狩猎后暖身醒神的绝佳选择！ 基础原料： 艾达奶酪切块（2杯切达碎奶酪或陈年高达奶酪，增加浓郁口感） 山羊奶酪楔（1杯碎山羊奶酪，增添酸香层次） *猛犸奶酪块（可选！或烟熏高达/格鲁耶尔奶酪替代烟熏风味） （译注：Gouda-高达奶酪 这是现实中的一种荷兰奶酪 Gruyère -格鲁耶尔奶酪 这是现实中的一种瑞士奶酪） 一壶牛奶（2杯全脂牛奶或浓奶油，打造丝滑质地） 面粉袋（2汤匙面粉，用于酱汁增稠） 海象脂肪（2汤匙，取代黄油，还原正宗斯卡尔风味！） 霜盐一撮（1/2茶匙烟熏海盐，注入冰原气息！） 火盐一撮（1/4茶匙卡宴辣椒粉或烟熏红椒粉，增添暖意对比） *杜松子半茶匙（可选，增添天际狂野风味！） *蒜粉半茶匙（取自裂谷城农场！） 泥蟹之魂： 整只熟泥蟹（务必去壳，否则变脆壳版！） 海象脂肪1汤匙（烹调蟹肉用！） （译注：sauté-烹调 这个词是现实中法式烹调的概念，表示将所有材料处理好，在锅里用较强的火力一起烹调，并且不用橄榄油） 诺德混合胡椒一撮（黑胡椒+干百里香！） 顶料（斯卡尔盛宴必备！）： *陈面包屑1杯（取自炉火之家自制面包！） 融化海象脂肪1汤匙（裹面包屑，打造粗犷酥脆顶！） *山羊奶酪碎一撒（增添颗粒口感！） 烟熏雪浆果粉一撮（烟熏红椒粉调色！） 烹饪指南——斯卡尔级盛宴 1. 煮制北境通心粉 篝火上将盐水大锅煮沸。 加入北境风通心粉（弯管通心粉、饺子面或东帝国商行扁面）。 沥干后置入温锅备用。 2. 烹制泥蟹肉 中火融化海象脂肪于平底锅。 加入泥蟹肉，撒诺德胡椒与火盐。 翻炒2-3分钟至微金黄，盛出备用。 3. 调制奶酪酱 铸铁锅中火融化2汤匙海象脂肪。 拌入面粉调成金黄面糊（如烤麦香）。 缓慢倒入牛奶，持续搅拌至顺滑。 加入霜盐、火盐、蒜粉、杜松子。 小火慢炖，偶尔搅拌。 离火后依次融化伊达尔奶酪、山羊奶酪与猛犸奶酪，搅拌至丝滑浓稠。 4. 融合盛宴 将通心粉倒入奶酪酱中均匀裹覆。 轻柔拌入泥蟹肉，确保分布均匀。 5. 海象酥脆顶（斯卡尔认证！） 预热烤炉（或炉火之家石灶）至375°F（190°C）。 将通心粉倒入涂脂诺德烤盘。 混合面包屑、融化霍克脂、山羊奶酪碎与烟熏雪浆果粉。 厚撒于表层，烤制15分钟至金黄酥脆。 6. 如斯卡尔勇士般大快朵颐！ 佐以蜜酿酒或香料诺德葡萄酒趁热享用。 饰以新鲜杜松枝或碎雪浆果提升野性美感。

original: Mudcrab Mac N' Cheese
string: 泥蟹通心粉奶酪

original: Crunchy Mudcrab Mac N' Cheese
string: 脆壳泥蟹通心粉奶酪

original: I have seen too much darkness to celebrate just yet. There is still much to do.
string: 我见过太多黑透了的事，现在庆祝还太早。要干的活还多着呢。

original: For the first time in many moons, I do not hear whispers in the wind.
string: 这还是这么久来第一次，风里没夹着那些低语。

original: Your path brought you to us. I wonder where it will lead you next.
string: 你追寻的道路把你引到了这里。不知道下一站是哪呢。

original: It is rare to meet an outsider who leaves Solstheim better than they found it.
string: 能把索瑟海姆变得比来时候更好的外乡人，我还没见过几个。

original: I have no patience for small talk. Not today.
string: 我没心情闲聊。今天不行。

original: He is gone. And now the weight of our people rests on my shoulders.
string: 他走了。现在族人的担子全压在我肩上。

original: The winds still blow, the world still turns.. but everything has changed.
string: 风还在吹，世界还在转……可什么都变了。

original: Hermaeus Mora takes without mercy. I only hope we have gained enough to justify the cost.
string: 赫麦尤斯·莫拉下手不留情。我只希望我们拿到的东西能抵这个价。

original: My father would not want me to dwell in sorrow, but it is hard to think of anything else.
string: 父亲不希望我沉溺在悲伤里，可我现在实在想不了别的。

original: I thought I understood what it meant to be strong. But strength did not save him.
string: 我以为自己知道什么叫坚强。可坚强却没能救回他。

original: The All-Maker teaches us balance.. but there is nothing balanced about this.
string: 造物主教我们平衡……可眼下这事根本谈不上平衡。

original: I do not care for Mora's gifts. But if they help you end this, I will not stop you.
string: 我不稀罕莫拉的礼物。但如果它们能帮你结束这事，我不会拦你。

original: The Skaal need a leader. I did not think it would be me so soon.
string: 斯卡尔需要一个领导者。但我从没想过那个人会是我。

original: You stand before someone who has lost everything. Choose your words carefully.
string: 你现在面前站着个一无所有的人。说话小心点。

original: You return. Good. The winds whispered of your coming.
string: 你回来了。很好。风里早传着你要来的消息。

original: The land remembers you, and so do I. It is always good to see a friend.
string: 这片土地记得你，我也记得。见到朋友总是好的。

original: I have learned much since we last spoke. But even wisdom must be set aside for action when needed.
string: 上次分别后我学了不少。但真到动手的时候，连智慧也得先放一边。

original: The Skaal are strong, but even the strongest need allies. You will always have a place here.
string: 斯卡尔人很硬气，但再硬也得有帮手。这儿永远有你一席之地。

original: The world beyond Solstheim still calls to you, I see. Do you ever grow tired of wandering?
string: 看来索瑟海姆外头的世界还在喊你。成天跑不累吗？

original: I have been thinking about our journey against Miraak. It is strange, how quickly fate changes our paths.
string: 我时常想起我们对抗米拉克的旅途。光阴似箭...时间流逝的速度，真是令人费解啊。

original: The All-Maker gives, and the All-Maker takes. I have come to accept this.. but I still wonder what lies beyond His design.
string: 造物主给予，造物主取走。我早已接受了这样的事实，但我就是想知道，在他的设计之外，还有什么。

original: I hope your travels have not brought too much trouble upon your shoulders. But knowing you, I suspect they have.
string: 我希望你这一路没惹太多麻烦。不过按你的性子，我估计不可能。

original: The wind carries many stories. Some of them even speak of you.
string: 风里夹着不少故事。关于你的还不少。

original: Life moves forward, and so must we. What brings you to Solstheim this time?
string: 生命向前行进，我们也该如此。这次是什么风把你吹来了索瑟海姆？

original: You are not like the others.. your mind is your own. That is a relief.
string: 你和他们不同……你的心智属于自己。这真让人松了口气。

original: We must be cautious. Miraak's poison runs deep, even here.
string: 我们必须小心。米拉克的毒根深蒂固，连这里也逃不过。

original: If you are truly Dragonborn, perhaps you can help us.
string: 如果你真是龙裔，或许可以帮到我们。

original: I do not trust easily.. but I trust that we need aid.
string: 我从不轻易相信别人……但我们的确需要帮助。

original: There is something familiar about you. But now is not the time for riddles.
string: 你身上有股熟悉的味道。但现在不是猜谜的时候。

original: Have you felt it? The air is heavy with unseen hands pulling at our thoughts.
string: 你感觉到了吗？空气里好像有只看不见的手在拉扯我们的思绪。

original: My father believes you can help us. I hope his faith is not misplaced.
string: 我的父亲相信你能帮我们。但愿他没信错人。

original: Strange that our paths should cross here, at the edge of ruin.
string: 真奇怪，我们的路偏偏在废墟边上碰到一起。

original: Do you hear them whispering? Miraak's shadow lingers over us still.
string: 你听见那些低语了吗？米拉克的阴魂还在缠着我们。

original: You stand before the last free Skaal. If we fall, there will be none left to tell our story.
string: 站在你面前的是最后自由的斯卡尔人。要是我们倒下，可就再也没有人记得我们的故事了。

original: You return.. and my people still stand. For that, I am grateful.
string: 你回来了……我的族人还活着。谢谢你为我们做的。

original: It is strange. The air feels lighter, yet I know our battle is not yet over.
string: 奇怪。空气好像变轻了，但我知道仗还没打完。

original: Because of you, my people are free. But I suspect you did not come just to hear my thanks.
string: 多亏你，我的族人自由了。但你不是来听我道谢的吧。

original: The Skaal owe you a debt, but I do not think you care much for such things.
string: 斯卡尔欠你的情，不过你大概不在乎这些。

original: I wonder.. do you fight only because it is your nature, or because you believe in something more?
string: 我在想……你打架是因为天生这样，还是心里信着更重要的东西？

original: The land still carries the scars of Miraak's curse, but at least my people no longer suffer.
string: 大地还留着米拉克诅咒的疤，但至少我的族人不用受苦了。

original: Take care. If I hear word of another great battle, I will assume you had something to do with it.
string: 保重。如果我听说又一场大战，我会猜你肯定掺了一脚。

original: Go well, my friend. Solstheim will always welcome you back.
string: 一路顺风，我的朋友。索瑟海姆永远欢迎你回来。

original: If you see something unnatural, steel yourself. It may try to take your will.
string: 如果看到不自然的东西，一定要坚定自己。它可能会试图夺走你的意志。

original: Even now, I can feel his eyes upon us. Let us not waste time.
string: 即使是现在，我也能感觉到他的眼睛在盯着我们。不要浪费时间。

original: Do not let his whispers take root in your mind. Resist, always.
string: 别让他的低语在你心里扎根。保持清醒。

original: I have seen many warriors fall to unseen hands. I hope you are stronger than they were.
string: 我见过许多战士败在无形之手下。希望你能比他们更强。

original: We must not let Miraak's madness spread beyond these walls.
string: 我们绝不能允许米拉克的疯狂蔓延出这些墙外。

original: If the winds guide you away from this place, I will not blame you.
string: 如果风指引你离开这里，我不会责怪你的。

original: Remember, the All-Maker watches. But even he cannot shield fools from their own choices.
string: 记住，造物主在看着。但就他也无法保护愚人免受自己选择的后果。

original: Go well, and know you are always welcome among the Skaal.
string: 祝你一路顺风。斯卡尔永远欢迎你。

original: The air is clear again. It is a good feeling.
string: 空气再度清澈。这种感觉很好。

original: You have given us a future. I hope you find yours as well.
string: 你给了我们一个未来。希望你也找到自己的路。

original: The land remembers what you have done. So do we.
string: 这片土地记得你所做的一切。我们也记得。

original: Miraak's grip is broken, but his shadow remains. We must remain watchful.
string: 米拉克的控制已被打破，但他的阴影仍在。我们必须保持警惕。

original: If you find yourself lost, return here. The wind will always guide you home.
string: 如果你迷茫了，就请回到这里吧。风会永远指引你回家的。

original: Not all debts can be repaid, but some can be honored. We will honor you always.
string: 并非所有债都能偿还，但有些值得被铭记。我们会永远敬重你。

original: Now that my people are free, I can finally think of the future. And of what comes next.
string: 既然我的族人自由了，我终于能想想未来。想想接下来该做什么。

original: I do not think you are one to settle down, but should you ever wish to, the Skaal would welcome you.
string: 我知道你不是安顿下来的人，但如果你真有这个念头，斯卡尔会欢迎你。

original: May the cold never claim you, and may you never lose yourself to power as Miraak did.
string: 愿严寒不侵你身，愿你免蹈米拉克的权欲覆辙。

original: Do not let his sacrifice be in vain.
string: 别让他的牺牲白费。

original: If Mora asks more of you, be wary. His hunger is endless.
string: 如果莫拉向你索求更多，一定要小心。他的贪婪没有尽头。

original: The Skaal will endure. We must.
string: 斯卡尔会坚持下去。我们必须如此。

original: Even as we grieve, we must move forward.
string: 即使悲痛难拭，我们也必须负重前行。

original: I will not break. I cannot.
string: 我不会倒下。我不能倒下。

original: The next storm will come. I must be ready for it.
string: 下一场风暴终将到来。我必须为此做好准备。

original: If you speak to Hermaeus Mora again, know that you walk a dangerous path.
string: 当你再次和赫麦尤斯·莫拉交谈，记住你正在踏足险境。

original: Some wounds do not heal, but they teach us how to carry them.
string: 有些伤口永远都不会愈合，但正是它们教会我们如何负重前行。

original: You are still welcome here. That has not changed.
string: 这里依然欢迎你。这一点从未改变。

original: Go now. The winds call for you, as they do for me.
string: 走吧。风在呼唤你，正如它在呼唤我。

original: Wherever your path leads, may the All-Maker guide you.
string: 无论你的路通向何方，愿造物主指引你。

original: Try not to get yourself killed. The world would be less interesting without you.
string: 尽量别把自己害死。没了你，这世界会少些趣味。

original: The Skaal endure, as do you. I trust we will meet again soon.
string: 斯卡尔会坚持下去，你也是。我相信我们很快会再见。

original: I will keep the hearth warm for your return. But do not take too long, I have stories to tell.
string: 我会守着篝火等你归来。但别耽搁太久，我还有故事要讲。

original: May the cold never claim you, and may your foes always fear your name.
string: 愿寒冷永远无法侵蚀你，愿你的敌人永远畏惧你的名字。

original: If you find yourself lost, listen to the wind. It always knows the way home.
string: 如果你迷失了，就听听风的声音。它永远知道回家的路。

original: One day, you must tell me all you have seen beyond these shores.
string: 总有一天，你得告诉我你在这些海岸之外看到的一切。

original: You are a wanderer, and I am a keeper of traditions... yet we always seem to meet in the middle.
string: 你是流浪者，而我是传统的守护者……但我们似乎总能在中间相遇。

original: Stay wary. These halls are not safe.
string: 保持警惕。这些厅堂并不安全。

original: The deeper we go, the darker Miraak's presence becomes.
string: 我们越深入，米拉克的气息就越发阴暗。

original: I want to know more about Solstheim & the Skaal.
string: 我想了解更多关于索瑟海姆和斯卡尔人的事。

original: Solstheim and the Skaal are one, our lives are tied to the land itself. What do you wish to know?
string: 索瑟海姆与斯卡尔人本为一体，我们的生命与这片土地紧密相连。你想了解什么？

original: Can you cook something for me?  I am hungry.
string: 能给我做点吃的吗？我饿了。

original: You expect me to cook for an outsider? Hmph. Do not ask for favors before earning them.
string: 你觉得我会一个外人做饭吗？哼，在要求回报前总得有些付出。

original: A meal? You have hands, do you not? The fire is there. The food is there. Figure it out.
string: 想吃饭？你又不是没长手。火在那儿，食材在那儿，自己想办法。

original: Why would I cook for you? You are not yet Skaal. Make your own food, like the rest of us.
string: 凭什么要我给你做饭？你还不算斯卡尔人。自己的事自己做，就像我们一样。

original: If you are starving, I suppose I could make something.. but do not expect it to be pleasant.
string: 要是快饿死了，我倒是可以给你做点东西……但别指望这会有多美味。

original: Fine. But I will not waste good cheese on a stranger.
string: 行吧。但我可不会把好奶酪浪费在陌生人身上。

original: You fight well and respect our ways. I suppose I can share a meal.
string: 你作战勇猛，也很敬重我们的传统。分你一顿饭倒也没事。

original: Ah, you seek my legendary Mudcrab Mac & Cheese? Very well, but I shall not reveal all my secrets just yet.
string: 啊，你想尝尝我拿手的泥蟹通心粉奶酪？行吧，但别指望我现在就透露所有秘方。

original: Cooking is like battle, you must use the right tools, be patient, and know when to strike. Sit. I will prepare something.
string: 烹饪就像战斗，用对工具，耐住性子，把握时机。坐好，我来准备。

original: Very well. You have proven yourself. But if I catch you wasting food, I shall make your next meal crunchy.
string: 很好。你已经证明了自己。但要是让我发现了你在浪费食物，我会让你下一顿吃得“嘎嘣脆”。

original: Hmph. You have earned this meal.. but if you insult my cooking, you will fight a mudcrab with your bare hands.
string: 哼。你赢得了这顿饭……但你要是敢侮辱我的厨艺，就等着徒手和泥蟹较量吧。

original: Ah, my friend! Of course, I shall cook for you. Would you like the classic recipe or the Skaal Warrior's Feast version?
string: 啊，我的朋友！当然，我会为你做饭的。你是想要经典配方，还是斯卡尔战士特供版？

original: You have earned a place among the Skaal, and a place at my fire. Sit. Eat. Enjoy.
string: 你赢得了在斯卡尔人中的尊重，也赢得了围坐在我的灶火旁的资格。坐下来好好享用吧。

original: Hah! You ask, and I deliver. Mudcrab Mac & Cheese, made with wisdom, warmth, and twice the cheese.
string: 哈！只要你想，我当然会做。泥蟹通心粉奶酪，佐以智慧、温情，外加双倍奶酪。

original: Do you know? I never imagined I would cook for an outsider.. and yet here we are. A strange world, but a good one.
string: 你知道吗？我从没想过有天会给一个外人做饭。但我们的确围在这。这个世界虽然怪极了，但有时候却也挺棒的。

original: Of course I will cook for you. But remember, you will always owe me a meal in return. One day, I shall collect.
string: 我当然会给你做饭的。但记住，你永远欠我一顿饭。总有一天，我会讨回来的。

original: Oh, now you wish for my cooking? Fine. I shall grant your request, crunch and all.
string: 哦，你现在想吃我做的饭了？好啊。满足你，带壳的也给你留着。

original: You doubt my skill? You will regret this when you bite into your first unexpected texture.
string: 你在怀疑我的厨艺吗？等你尝到第一口的时候，可别后悔。

original: Yes, I will cook. But let this be a lesson: Patience earns soft noodles. Impatience earns shards.
string: 好好好，我做我做。但记住这个教训：耐心得软面，急躁得碎渣。

original: Oh, you are in a hurry? Then I shall not waste time removing the shell. Enjoy.
string: 哦，你已经饿坏啦？那我就不去壳了。好好享用吧。

original: Hmph. The All-Maker teaches patience. You have not learned it yet. Eat. And chew carefully.
string: 哼。造物主教人耐心。看来你还没学会。吃慢点，记得细嚼慢咽。

original: May I have the regular Mudcrab Mac N Cheese?
string: 我要常规款泥蟹通心粉奶酪。

original: Ah, so you have chosen the path of wisdom. Very well, one regular Mudcrab Mac & Cheese, free of unexpected textures.
string: 啊，明智之举。行哒，一份常规泥蟹通心粉奶酪，保证不含“意外口感”。

original: But remember.. true strength is forged through challenge. One day, you may be ready for the crunch.
string: 但记住……真正的力量需经锤炼。总有一天，你会准备好迎接脆壳的挑战的。

original: Give me the Crunchy!
string: 给我来份脆壳的！

original: Ah, a bold request! You seek not just a meal, but a trial of endurance.
string: 啊，好大的口气！你要的可不只是餐点，更是耐力的试炼。

original: Very well, one Crunchy Mudcrab Mac & Cheese, crafted with the full essence of the beast.
string: 行，一份脆壳泥蟹通心粉奶酪，以全兽精髓烹制。

original: May your jaw be strong, and your resolve stronger.
string: 愿你的牙口够硬，意志更坚。

original: I want to know more about Miraak and Hermaeus Mora.
string: 我想了解更多关于米拉克和赫麦尤斯·莫拉的事。

original: Miraak's name is cursed among the Skaal, and Herma-Mora is no better. If you wish to speak of them, I will not hold back. What do you want to know?
string: 米拉克的名字在斯卡尔人中是禁忌，而赫麦尤斯·莫拉也好不到哪儿去。谈他们的事，我当然会实话实说。你想知道什么？

original: I want to know more about your role with the Skaal.
string: 我想了解你在斯卡尔人中的地位。

original: I am still finding my place. If you seek my thoughts, I will share them, but I do not yet have all the answers.
string: 我仍然在寻找自己的定位。不过要是你想听听我的看法，我当然来者不拒，但我的确还没找到答案。

original: I want to ask you some personal questions and about us.
string: 我想问你一些私人问题，还有关于我们的事。

original: The Skaal believe that all who cross our path leave their mark upon us. If you wish to speak, I will listen.
string: 斯卡尔人坚信每个与我们相遇的人都会留下痕迹。你想说就说吧，我听着。

original: I want your opinion on somethings.
string: 我想听听你对某些事情的看法。

original: Ask me anything, and I will answer. What weighs on your heart?
string: 尽管问，我会回答的。你心里在想什么？

original: Very well, but let us be quick. What is on your mind?
string: 好啊，但长话短说。你想聊什么？

original: If speaking will ease the weight on our hearts, then so be it. What shall we talk about?
string: 如果倾诉能减轻我们心中的重担，那就尽管说说看吧。你想谈哪件事？

original: The battle is over, but our journey continues. What troubles your mind?
string: 战斗结束了，但路还长着。你有什么心事吗？

original: I am here, and I will listen. What shall we speak of today?
string: 我在这听着呢。今天想聊点什么？

original: What are your thoughts about the events for the Dragonborn storyline?
string: 你对龙裔传说中的事件有什么看法？

original: The Skaal teach that wisdom is shared, not hoarded. Tell me, what troubles you?
string: 斯卡尔人教导智慧需要分享而非私藏。说吧，你有什么困扰？

original: Even the winds do not reveal all their secrets at once. When I have an answer, I will share it with you.
string: 即便风也不会一次吐露所有秘密。等我找到答案，自然会给你分享的。

original: I hear the wind, but it no longer carries his voice.
string: 我听见风声，但其中不再会有他的声音。

original: The Skaal do not mourn as the Nords do. We do not wail, nor do we call upon the Divines to guard our dead.
string: 斯卡尔人的哀悼与诺德人不同。我们不会恸哭，也不会祈求圣灵守护逝者。

original: We accept the return to the All-Maker as part of the cycle.
string: 我们接受回归造物主的宿命，这是循环的一部分。

original: And yet, I linger here, listening for a voice I will never hear again.
string: 而我仍驻足于此，聆听那个永远不会再响起的声音。

original: Perhaps you are right.
string: 或许你说得对。

original: My father always said that death is merely a return, that we must not cling to those who have moved beyond this life.
string: 我父亲总说，死亡不过是回归，我们不该执着于已超脱此生的人。

original: But.. How does one let go of the hands that once guided them?
string: 可……一个人又要怎么放开曾经引导自己的手？

original: I do not know if I am ready to move forward.
string: 我不知道自己是否准备好往前走。

original: But standing still will not bring him back.
string: 但原地踏步不会让他回来。

original: Perhaps I should listen to my own teachings for once.
string: 或许这次我该听听自己的教诲。

original: You seem troubled. Is something on your mind?
string: 你看起来心事重重。有什么困扰吗？

original: How are you holding up, Frea?
string: 你还好吗，芙瑞雅？

original: The wind still carries sorrow, but it does not feel as heavy as before.
string: 风仍捎来哀伤，但已不似往日那般沉重。

original: My father is with the All-Maker.. and I remain.
string: 我的父亲已归于造物主……而我仍在尘世。

original: That is as it should be.
string: 本该如此。

original: I have come to understand something.
string: 我最近想明白了一些事。

original: The wisdom of my father was never meant to be held onto like a relic, it was meant to be lived.
string: 我父亲的智慧不该像圣物般被供奉，而是该被践行使用。

original: I will honor him by walking my own path, as he once walked his.
string: 我会走自己的路来纪念他，就像他当年那样。

original: You lost your father, Frea. It is only natural to grieve.
string: 你失去了父亲，芙瑞雅。感到悲伤是人之常情。

original: The Skaal mourn differently, but you can find your own way.
string: 斯卡尔有自己的哀悼方式，但你可以找到属于你的路。

original: You do not have to face this alone
string: 你不必独自承受这一切。

original: You do not have to let go. You can carry his lessons forward.
string: 你不必放下过去。你可以继续践行他的教诲。

original: In time, the pain will fade, but his memory will remain.
string: 时光会冲淡伤痛，但那些远去的记忆永不消逝。

original: The All-Maker takes but also gives, you will understand in time.
string: 造物主会索取，但也会给予，你最终会理解的。

original: The wind speaks to those who listen. Some hear whispers of the past. Others hear nothing at all. And you? What do you hear?
string: 风会和倾听者交谈。有人会听见往昔的低语，有人仅仅听闻寥寥的空寂。你呢？你听到了什么？

original: Hmph. Not bad craftsmanship. Solid balance, clean edge.. though I would not trust it in a true storm. Even a warrior appreciates the tools of war.
string: 嗯。锻造手艺不差。重心稳当，利刃干净……不过在真正的风暴里我可能不会信任它。战士也该看重自己的武器。

original: Nords are stubborn. Skaal, even more so. Perhaps that is why the world insists on testing us. We do not break easily.
string: 诺德人固执，斯卡尔人...甚至更胜一筹。或许这就是世界总是考验我们的原因。我们没那么容易被打垮。

original: Fire and frost, always at war. A cycle as old as the land itself. And yet.. both are needed to survive. Much like people, I suppose.
string: 火焰与寒霜永远在争斗。如同这片土地一样古老的循环……但生存需要两者并存。我想，人也一样。

original: There is strength in silence. Words cannot solve every battle. Sometimes, it is better to let the world speak first. Or people tire from the noise.
string: 沉默中自有力量。言语解不开每场战斗。有时让世界先开口更好。或者等那些喧嚣自己疲惫。

original: No hunter wastes a kill. The pelt warms, the meat sustains, the bones sharpen to weapons. Do not tell me you waste what you take.
string: 没有猎人会浪费猎物。毛皮御寒，鲜肉果腹，硬骨磨作兵刃。可别告诉我你会糟蹋到手的东西。

original: The cold is a teacher. It does not care for weakness, nor does it reward arrogance. It simply is. You learn.. or you perish.
string: 寒冷是最好的老师。它不在意软弱，也不奖赏傲慢。它只是存在。要么学会……要么灭亡。

original: You fight as you live. Some charge in without thought, reckless and wild. Others wait, calculating their every move.  And you? How do you live?
string: 你战斗的方式便是生存之道。有人莽撞冲杀，狂野不羁。有人谋定后动，步步为营。你呢？你如何活着？

original: The Skaal endure. We always have. Even when the world forgets us, even when the storms rage. That is enough.
string: 斯卡尔延续着。向来如此。纵使天地遗忘我们，纵使风暴肆虐。这就足够。

original: This city sits upon open plains, unguarded by stone or ice. It is no wonder the Nords here cling to their walls and watchtowers like frightened foxes
string: 这座城市建在开阔平原，既无石墙也没冰障。难怪这的诺德人全都像些受惊的狐狸死守着城墙和瞭望塔。

original: Dragons once ruled this sky, and yet these people name their fortress Dragonreach. A bold challenge, or a foolish one?
string: 巨龙曾统治这片天空，而这些人却将堡垒命名为龙临堡。是无畏的挑战，还是愚蠢之举？

original: They worship Kynareth here, yet I see little reverence for the land beneath their feet. The wind carries whispers of neglect.
string: 他们在此崇拜凯娜瑞丝，却对脚下的土地毫无敬意。风里飘荡着疏于照管的低语。

original: This city is like a bird's nest clinging to the cliffs. It is a wonder the land has not cast it into the sea.
string: 这城市就像悬崖上的鸟窝。真意外大地还没将它抛入海中。

original: The people here feast in warm halls while their warriors die in cold fields. There is honor in battle, but there is none in ruling from afar.
string: 人们在温暖厅堂宴饮，战士却在冰冷原野赴死。上阵杀敌中自有荣耀，但坐镇后方真是懦夫之举。

original: This city sings songs of empire and war, yet it feels.. weary. Even the stones seem to long for something lost.
string: 这座城市吟唱着帝国与战争，却透着……疲倦。连石头都在渴求失落的往昔。

original: These walls may stand against the cold, but the hearts of its people? Frozen in anger and fear. Even the wind here carries their hatred.
string: 城墙或许能抵御严寒，但民众的心呢？恐怕早已被愤怒与恐惧冻结了吧。连这里的风都裹挟着他们的恨意。

original: I see no love for the land in this city, only a hunger for battle and old grudges. If they are not careful, they will burn all including themselves.
string: 这座城毫无对土地的敬爱，满是对厮杀与旧怨的饥渴。若再不留神，他们终将焚尽一切，包括自己。

original: This is a city of warriors, but I wonder.. Do they fight for their kin, or only for their own pride?
string: 战士之城，但我想知道……他们是为族人而战，还是仅为自己的傲慢？

original: A city built upon rot will always sink, no matter how high its walls rise.
string: 建在腐朽之上的城市终将沉没，城墙再高也无济于事。

original: The waters here are not like those of Solstheim. They do not cleanse. They only hide filth beneath their surface.
string: 这的水不像索瑟海姆那般纯净。它们无法涤净污秽，只会将肮脏藏在波光之下。

original: The people of this city whisper like crows in the trees. Never trust a man who smiles while his hands are empty.
string: 这座城市的的人就像是树梢上的鸦群，总在窃窃私语。永远不要相信一个两手空空却面带微笑的人。

original: Stone may be strong, but even the mountains will crack if enough blood seeps into them.
string: 磐石虽坚，浸透鲜血，高山亦崩。

original: The air here is heavy with old grudges. No amount of gold or stone will make a place whole when its people still bleed.
string: 这里的空气弥漫着旧怨。当人们仍在流血时，再多的金银财宝或石头也无法让一个地方完整。

original: The people here fear the dreams of dark spirits. Hmph. A weak mind gives the dark a place to fester.
string: 这里的人畏惧恶灵托梦。哼，懦弱的心智才会让黑暗滋生。

original: The All-Maker teaches that knowledge should be earned, not stolen. Herma Mora twists this truth into something vile.
string: 造物主教导，知识应凭努力获取而非窃取。赫麦尤斯·莫拉却将这真理扭曲为卑劣之物。

original: We have freed our people, yet I cannot celebrate. My father is gone... and the path ahead is darker still.
string: 我们救回了族人，我却难以融入欢庆。父亲他不在了……前方的道路反而更加晦暗。

original: Look at them.. their minds were stolen, their hands were forced to work against their own home. But no more, this madness has ended.
string: 看看他们......心智遭夺，双手被迫摧毁家园。但到此为止，这场疯狂终将落幕。

original: The Skaal have endured much, but this? To be stripped of mind and soul, turned into slaves.. it is a cruelty beyond words.
string: 斯卡尔人承受过许多苦难，但像这般被剥夺心智与灵魂，沦为奴隶……这样的暴行无以言表。

original: I feel the wind shifting. The All-Maker guides us, but it is we who must take the first step.
string: 我感觉到风在转向。造物主在指引我们，但踏出第一步的终是我们自己。

original: I have always known the cost of wisdom can be steep... but never have I seen such a price paid in full.
string: 我一直都知道智慧的代价相当高昂……却从未见过如此彻底的偿还。

original: This town does not belong to its people. It belongs to the swamp. And the swamp is patient.
string: 这座镇子不属于它的居民。它属于沼泽。而沼泽的耐心不会持续太久。

original: A quiet place, but not a safe one. The dead here do not sleep as they should. And that is always a bad sign.
string: 一个安静的地方，但并不安全。这里的死者并未安息，这可不是好兆头。

original: So many dead in one place..  Even the air carries their sorrow. This land has known much grief.
string: 如此多的亡魂聚于一处……连空气都浸透他们的哀伤。这片土地承载了太多悲怆。

original: A forest should be full of life, yet here, it feels more like a grave. The trees whisper of things long buried.
string: 森林本该生机盎然，这里却像个坟场。树木低语着深埋已久的秘密。

original: They burn their dead in great pyres, yet their memories still linger like old ghosts. Perhaps the past is not so easily turned to ash.
string: 他们用火焰焚化逝者，但记忆依旧会化作往日的幽魂徘徊。也许过去没那么容易化为灰烬。

original: A city that once stood proud, now little more than a memory. It is foolish to build so close to the sea and think yourself its master.
string: 曾经傲然矗立的城市，如今不过是一个记忆的残影。靠海而建，却妄想掌控大海，这是何等的愚蠢。

original: The mages here wield great power, yet even they could not stop their home from falling into the waves. Magic does not make one wise.
string: 这里的法师们拥有强大的力量，即便如此，却连家园沉入浪涛都无力阻止。魔法并不能使人变得明智。

original: The College stands untouched, while the rest of the city crumbles. If that is not a sign of misplaced priorities, I do not know what is.
string: 学院依旧完好无损，而城市的其余部分却在分崩离析。如果这还不算本末倒置，那我真不知道什么是了。

original: Even the greatest voices are humbled by the silence of the mountain. This is a place for listening, not speaking.
string: 再洪亮的声音也会被山岳的静默折服。这是一个适宜聆听的静默之地。

original: The air here is sharp and pure. The Skaal say the wind carries wisdom, if you are willing to hear it.
string: 这里的空气清新而凛冽。斯卡尔有句谚语，“风中蕴含着智慧，只要你愿意侧耳倾听。”

original: The Greybeards seek peace in stillness. But I wonder, when the world calls, will they answer, or only watch?
string: 灰胡子在静默中寻求平和。但我很好奇，当世界呼唤时，他们是会回应，还是冷眼旁观呢？

original: Your Life Well runs deep, like the oldest trees of the Skaal. Few can endure as you do.
string: 你的生命如同斯卡尔古树深邃。很少有人能像你这样坚韧。

original: You stand unyielding, as if the cold itself cannot touch you. The All-Maker has shaped you well.
string: 你屹立不摇，仿佛寒冷根本无法触及你。造物主把你塑造得如此完美。

original: Strength like yours is rare. But even the strongest mountain crumbles if it stands alone.
string: 有你这样力量的人很罕见。恐怕最坚固的山峰，如果孤立无援，也会在你面前崩塌。

original: I have seen warriors fall after a single blow. You? You would make them weep for their frailty.
string: 我见过战士被一击即溃。而你？你会让那些人为自己的脆弱痛哭。

original: If your enemies hope to wear you down, they are in for a long, miserable battle.
string: 如果你的敌人试图和你打消耗战，他们肯定会陷入漫长而痛苦的鏖战。

original: You move like a wolf in pursuit, tireless and unshaken. Good, only the swift survive in these lands.
string: 你的步伐像只追逐猎物的狼，不知疲倦，毫不动摇。很好，在这片土地上，只有迅捷者才能生存。

original: You could outlast even the most stubborn Horker. Remind me never to challenge you to a race.
string: 你甚至能熬过最顽固的海象。但愿我永远别和你赛跑。

original: Your Adrenal Pool is vast. You run, you fight, you endure. Perhaps you have Nord blood after all.
string: 你的精力之池深不见底。奔跑，战斗，忍耐。也许你骨子里真有诺德血统。

original: With such boundless energy, I wonder if even the wind could catch you.
string: 拥有这样无穷的精力，我怀疑连风都追不上你。

original: A warrior who never tires is a warrior who always has the advantage. Use it well.
string: 一个不知疲倦的战士永远占据上风。善用这份天赋。

original: Your Aetheric Well glows like the auroras in the night sky. I hope you wield it wisely.
string: 你的以太之井如夜穹极光般闪耀。希望你能明智地运用它。

original: You hold more power than most mages I have met. Just do not let it consume you, as it did Miraak.
string: 你掌握的力量比大多数我见过的法师都要强大。但切忌让力量吞噬了你，就像它吞噬了米拉克一样。

original: I can feel the energy around you, it hums like the breath of the wind. The spirits must whisper to you often.
string: 我能感受到你周围的能量，它轻鸣着，就像风的呼吸。精魂们一定常常对你低语。

original: Your strength is not in steel, but in the unseen forces of the world. A rare gift, but a dangerous one.
string: 你的力量并非来自钢铁，而是来自世间无形的力量。这是一种罕见的天赋，但也是一种危险的天赋。

original: Even among the Skaal, such power is uncommon. Just remember: the greatest magic is knowing when not to use it.
string: 即便在斯卡尔人中，这样的力量也不多见。但请记住：最伟大的魔法，是懂得何时不施法。

original: This land is honest. Harsh winds, biting cold, yet it does not hide its nature, unlike the people who claim it.
string: 这片土地很诚实。凛风刺骨，但它从不遮掩本性，不像那些声称拥有它的人。

original: Mist rolls through these streets like a living thing. It watches. It listens. The wise would do the same.
string: 雾气漫过街巷，仿佛它有着生机。它在注视，在聆听。就像一个智者。

original: They carve their homes into the mountain, yet forget the earth does not bow to kings. One day, the rock will swallow them whole.
string: 他们将家园凿入山体，却忘了大地不会向君王屈服。总有一天，岩石会将他们尽数吞噬。

original: A city that wakes in fear each morning is a city that will not last. They must either fight the darkness or be swallowed by it.
string: 每日在恐惧中苏醒的城市注定消亡。他们要么与黑暗搏斗，要么被它吞没。

original: To think my people have walked these stones for generations, unaware of the corruption beneath them.. We have been blind for too long.
string: 我的族人世代踏过这些石地，却浑然不知脚底下的腐化……我们迷失在蒙昧太久了

original: I do not fear the name Miraak. It is the will of the All-Maker that I walk this path, and I will not waver.
string: 我不怕那个叫米拉克的人。这是造物主的指引，我绝不会动摇。

original: These halls were built to honor the Dragons. Now they reek of a traitor's presence.. This is not the way of the Skaal.
string: 这些厅堂本为敬龙而建，如今却浸满叛徒的气息……这不是斯卡尔人的方式。

original: What can you tell me about Solstheim?
string: 你能给我讲讲索瑟海姆吗？

original: Solstheim is harsh, but it is our home.
string: 索瑟海姆环境恶劣，但它仍然是我们的家。

original: The Skaal have lived here for generations, in harmony with the land and the All-Maker. But lately, I fear something threatens that balance.
string: 斯卡尔人世世代代生活在这，与土地和造物主和谐共生。但最近，我担心有什么东西会威胁到这种平衡。

original: Solstheim has endured many changes, and so have its people.
string: 索瑟海姆历经沧桑，生活在这的人亦是如此。

original: The Skaal remain, as we always have, but we must now look to the future rather than just hold onto the past
string: 但斯卡尔人依然坚守着，我们不能一味守着过去，必须放眼未来。

original: Tell me about the Skaal.
string: 跟我讲讲斯卡尔人吧。

original: The Skaal have always survived by holding to our traditions.
string: 斯卡尔人依靠恪守传统延续至今。

original: But I have come to see that tradition alone does not keep a people strong, understanding and adaptation are just as important.
string: 但我逐渐明白，仅靠传统无法让一个族群强盛，理解与变通同样至关重要。

original: We are the true people of Solstheim, keepers of the All-Maker's teachings.
string: 我们是索瑟海姆真正的子民，造物主教诲的守护者。

original: We do not take from the land without giving in return. It is our way.
string: 我们不会只索取而不回报。这是我们的生存之道。

original: Do the Skaal ever leave Solstheim?
string: 斯卡尔人会离开索瑟海姆吗？

original: Rarely. Our home is here, and we do not seek to spread our ways beyond Solstheim.
string: 很少。我们生长于此，也无意把传统播撒到索尔海姆以外的地方。

original: But I have begun to wonder.. if our ways are so strong, why should they not be shared?
string: 但我最近总在想……如果我们的传统足够强大，又何尝不能分享呢？

original: Some of our people may leave, and some may return.
string: 或许会有人离开，也或许会有人归来。

original: I do not believe the Skaal must always remain isolated. The world changes. We must learn when to change with it.
string: 我不认为斯加尔人必须永远与世隔绝。世界在变化。我们必须学会与时俱进。

original: What do you think of Miraak?
string: 你对米拉克有什么看法？

original: A traitor. He abandoned his people, turned his back on the All-Maker, and let his greed consume him. I will not do the same.
string: 叛徒。他背弃族人，背离造物主，任由贪婪吞噬自己。我绝不会重蹈覆辙。

original: Miraak was not born a monster, but he became one. I do not pity him, but I do wonder if things could have been different.
string: 米拉克并非生来就是怪物，但他却成了怪物。我不同情他，但我确实想过是否会有不同的结局。

original: Do you trust Hermaeus Mora?
string: 你相信赫麦尤斯·莫拉吗？

original: No. A being like Herma-Mora does not give gifts freely. He takes. Always.
string: 不信。像莫拉这样的存在不会无偿赐予礼物。他只会索取。向来如此。

original: Herma-Mora is what he is. A force, like the wind or the tide. He does not lie, but his truths come at a cost.
string: 莫拉就是莫拉。像风浪般的存在。他不说谎，但真相的代价高昂。

original: I will never seek his guidance, but I will not ignore what he has already taught us.
string: 我永远不会寻求他的指引，但也不会无视他已教给我们的东西。

original: Would you ever take knowledge from Mora?
string: 你会从莫拉那里获取知识吗？

original: Never. Knowledge should be earned, not stolen or given by beings beyond our world.
string: 永远不会。知识应该凭借努力获得，而不是靠偷窃或者异界存在的施舍。

original: I have already taken knowledge from Mora, whether I wished to or not. The question is what I will do with it.
string: 但不管我是否愿意，我都从莫拉那里获得了知识。现在的问题是我该如何运用它。

original: How are you handling being the new shaman?
string: 作为新任萨满，你适应得如何？

original: I have made peace with it. My father's path was his own, and mine is my own. I will lead as Frea, not as Storn's daughter.
string: 但我也已经释怀了。父亲有他的路，我有我的路。我将以芙瑞雅的身份引领族人，而不是史东的女儿。

original: I do what I must. But I still feel as though I walk in my father's shadow.
string: 尽力而为吧。我仍然觉得自己活在父亲的影子里。

original: Do you ever wish you could just be a warrior again?
string: 你可曾怀念单纯当战士的日子？

original: Every day. The path of the shaman is not easy, nor is it one I ever sought.
string: 每天都在想。萨满之路并不容易，也不是我所追求的。

original: I will always be a warrior. But I now know that strength does not only come from a blade, it comes from wisdom as well.
string: 我永远都是个战士。但我如今明白，力量不仅仅来源于利刃，同时也需要智慧的辅佐。

original: Do you still believe in the All-Maker after everything?
string: 经历了这一切，你还坚信着造物主吗？

original: Yes. His will is all around us. Even in hardship, even in sorrow, the cycle continues.
string: 当然。他的意志无处不在。纵使困苦哀伤，循环仍在继续。

original: I do. But I also believe we must find our own path within His design. Even the All-Maker does not guide every step, we must choose where to walk.
string: 是的。但我也相信，我们需要在他的安排中走出自己的路。造物主不会指引每一步，我们必须选择行进的方向。

original: Who is the All-Maker?
string: 造物主是谁？

original: The All-Maker is the source of all life, the great force that shapes and sustains the world.
string: 造物主是生命之源，是塑造并维系世界的伟力。

original: We do not worship him as others do their gods. We honor him by living in balance with his creation.
string: 我们不像其他信仰般膜拜他。我们凭借和他的造物共生平衡来尊崇他。

original: The land, the trees, the beasts, even the sky and sea, these are all his gifts, and we must not take more than we are given.
string: 土地、林木、野兽，乃至天穹与海洋，皆为他的馈赠，我们不能索取无度。

original: Those who follow the Divines or the Daedra may not understand.
string: 这对圣灵或者迪德拉的信众或许难以理解。

original: They seek favor, blessings, or power. But the All-Maker does not grant such things.
string: 他们渴求恩宠、赐福或力量。但造物主从不施舍这些。

original: He only provides the world as it is meant to be. It is up to us to walk the path he has set.
string: 他只将世界呈现为应有之貌。行走他铺就的道路，是我们自己的选择。

original: The All-Maker is.. balance. He is not a god like the ones worshipped in Skyrim or beyond.
string: 造物主即……平衡。他不同于天际或其他地域所膜拜的神明。

original: He is in the wind, in the soil, in the beating heart of all living things.
string: 他在风中，在土里，在所有生灵跃动的心脏中。

original: He does not demand temples or prayers, only that we respect the order of the world he has given us.
string: 他无需庙宇或祈祷，只求我们尊重他赐予世界的秩序。

original: And yet.. I wonder. If all things happen according to his design, then was Miraak's betrayal part of that?
string: 然而……我常常想。如果世间万物皆由他的设计运转，那米拉克的背叛是否也在其中？

original: Was my father's death? I do not have the answers. But I still believe in the All-Maker, even if I now walk my own path to understanding him.
string: 我父亲的死呢？我找不到答案。但依然坚信着造物主，即便如今我仍以自身的方式去尝试理解他。

original: The All-Maker is not a being to be spoken to, nor a master who rewards or punishes.
string: 造物主并非不可交流的存在，但也不是赏罚分明的主宰。

original: He is the wind that carries us forward, the fire that warms us, the water that sustains us.
string: 他是指引前行的风，是温暖我们的火，是滋养生命的水。

original: He is the beginning and the end of all things, but it is we who must shape the path between.
string: 他是万物的起始与终结，但中间的路径须由我们自行开拓。

original: For a long time, I saw the world in simple terms, balance, order, the cycle of life. But now, I see that life is not always so simple.
string: 长久以来，我将世界看得简单——平衡、秩序、生命轮回。但如今我明白，世事并非总是如此分明。

original: Sometimes the land shifts beneath our feet.
string: 有时大地亦会在脚下移位。

original: Sometimes the wind does not guide us where we expect.
string: 有时风会将我们引向意料之外的方向。

original: And that is why I no longer follow blindly, I choose to walk with the All-Maker, not merely beneath him.
string: 正因如此，我不再盲目追随，而是选择与造物主同行，而非屈居其下。

original: Perhaps that is what it truly means to understand him, not as an untouchable force, but as something that lives with us, as we live with the land.
string: 或许这才是真正理解他的方式——不视其为遥不可及的力量，而是与我们同在的存在，如同我们与土地共生。

original: And if you cannot believe in him as I do, that is fine. For in the end, the wind blows where it will, whether we name it or not.
string: 要是你没法像我一样相信他，这倒也没关系。毕竟风终将吹向它该去之处，无论我们是否为其命名。

original: Do you still think of your father?
string: 你还会时常想起父亲吗？

original: Every moment. But I must be strong for my people.
string: 每时每刻都在。但我必须为族人们坚强。

original: Yes, but not with sorrow. His lessons live on in me. That is what truly matters.
string: 会，但我不会再沉溺于悲伤。他的教诲活在我心中，这才是最重要的。

original: You seem different since we first met.
string: 你看起来和初次见面时不同了。

original: Perhaps. Or perhaps I was always this way, and I simply had not yet been tested.
string: 也许吧。或许我一直都是这样，只是还没有接受过考验。

original: I am different. We all change, and I no longer fear that change.
string: 我的确不同了。人总会变的，而我将不再畏惧改变。

original: Do you still consider me an outsider?
string: 你还当我是外人吗？

original: You are not Skaal. But you fight for us, and that earns my respect.
string: 你并非斯卡尔人。但你为我们而战，这赢得了我的尊重。

original: No. You are a friend. And in some ways, you have become part of our story.
string: 不。你是朋友。某种意义上，你已然成为我们故事中的一部分。

original: What will you do now?
string: 接下来你要怎么做？

original: Lead my people. Protect them. Try to be the shaman my father believed I could be.
string: 我会引领族人，守护他们。竭力成为父亲所期待的萨满。

original: Live. Learn. And, perhaps, see more of the world than I once thought possible.
string: 活下去。去学习。或许……去看看我曾以为无法触及的世界。

original: If I left and never returned, would you miss me?
string: 如果我离开后再也不回来，你会挂念我吗？

original: Yes. But I do not think you are the sort to disappear forever. The winds will bring you back to me, one way or another.
string: 会。但我不信你会永远消失。风终会将你带回我身边，无论以何种方式。

original: I would remember you, as I remember all who shape the Skaal's fate.
string: 我会铭记你的，就像铭记所有改变斯卡尔命运的人一样。

original: Frea, do you know how to cook?
string: 芙瑞雅，你会做饭吗？

original: Do I know how to cook? Hah! What kind of question is that?
string: 我会不会做饭？哈！这算什么问题？

original: A Skaal must know how to cook, just as they must know how to hunt, build, and survive the cold.
string: 斯卡尔人必须会做饭，正如必须会狩猎、造屋、抵御严寒。

original: I can roast meat over a fire, prepare a proper stew, and bake bread hardy enough to keep a warrior on their feet for days.
string: 我能烤肉炖汤，也能烤出够战士啃上几天的硬面包。

original: And if you are truly fortunate, I might even make you Mudcrab Mac 'n Cheese.
string: 要是你走运的话，我可能还会给你做泥蟹通心粉奶酪。

original: Crunchy or normal, your choice. Just know that if you choose crunchy, you forfeit the right to complain.
string: 脆壳还是常规，随你选。但要是想吃脆壳，到时可别抱怨哦。

original: Tell me the story how you came across Mudcrab Mac N Cheese
string: 跟我讲讲你是怎么发明泥蟹通心粉奶酪的？

original: Ah, so you wish to know the secret of my Mudcrab Mac & Cheese?
string: 啊，你想知道我的泥蟹通心粉奶酪的秘密？

original: Hah! It was not taught to me by mortals. No, I learned it.. from the wind.
string: 哈！这可不是别人教我的。不，我是……从风里学来的。

original: You see, one night, deep in the snowdrifts of Solstheim, I listened.
string: 你想象一下，某天夜里，我独自坐在索瑟海姆的雪堆里，侧耳倾听。

original: The wind howled through the trees, whispering secrets of the land. I asked it, Oh mighty wind, what is the key to a truly hearty meal?
string: 风呼啸过树梢，低语着大地的秘密。我问它：“哦，伟大的风啊，真正饱腹一餐的秘诀是什么？”

original: And it answered..
string: 它回答……

original: More cheese, it said.
string: “多加奶酪，”它说。

original: And lo, the next morning, I found a mudcrab on the shore, as if the All-Maker himself had placed it there for me.
string: 结果第二天清晨，我在岸边发现一只泥蟹，仿佛造物主亲手为我放在那儿。

original: I boiled it, cracked its shell, mixed it with the finest noodles and a sacred amount of cheese.
string: 我把它煮了，敲开壳，配上最好的通心粉，再加上神圣分量的奶酪。

original: And when I took my first bite, the wind whispered once more..
string: 当我咬下第一口，风又低语道……

original: Yesss, that is the way..
string: “对，这就对了……”

original: And that is how I came to know the truth of Mudcrab Mac & Cheese. Now, do you wish to eat, or do you wish to doubt the wisdom of the wind?
string: 这就是我参透泥蟹通心粉奶酪真谛的经过。现在，你是想吃呢，还是想质疑风的智慧？

original: How do the Skaal make noodles?
string: 斯卡尔人怎么做面条？

original: You think the Skaal fear a lack of noodles? Ha! The land provides, if you know how to listen.
string: 你以为斯卡尔人会怕没面条吃？哈！要是你学会倾听，大地自然会馈赠。

original: Long ago, before your fancy Imperial markets and your imported wheat, the Skaal knew the secret of the wild noodle.
string: 早在你们那些花哨的帝国市场和进口小麦出现前，斯卡尔人就掌握了野麦面的秘密。

original: We foraged for hardy grains, milled them with stone, and crafted them into sacred strands using nothing but ice-cold water and sheer determination.
string: 我们采集硬质谷物，用石磨碾碎，仅凭冰水与铁打的毅力，便搓出了神圣的面条。

original: Some say our ancestors wrestled the flour from a frost troll's grip.
string: 有人说我们的祖先是从冰霜巨魔爪下抢来的面粉。

original: Others say the dough was kneaded beneath the Northern Lights, granting it divine texture.
string: 还有人说面团是在极光下揉成的，因而获得了神赐的筋道。

original: But the true secret? You must scream at the dough, shout at it like a Nord calling for war!
string: 但真正的秘诀是什么呢？你得对着面团咆哮，像诺德人宣战般怒吼！

original: It must fear you into submission, lest it become chewy and unworthy.
string: 得让它畏惧屈服，否则就会变得又硬又难嚼。

original: The wind, the flour, and the soul of the cook must be in harmony.
string: 风、面粉与厨师的灵魂必须和谐共鸣。

original: So yes, I made noodles in Solstheim. Because I am Skaal.
string: 所以没错，我在索瑟海姆做面条。因为我是斯卡尔人。

original: And because I refuse to live in a world without cheese-covered glory.
string: 还因为我拒绝活在一个没有奶酪荣光的世上。

original: Now, will you eat, or will you question the ways of the Skaal further?
string: 现在，你是继续吃捏，还是继续质疑斯卡尔人的智慧？

original: Umm why is there a crunchy version?
string: 呃，为什么会有脆壳版？

original: Ah, the crunchy version?
string: 啊，脆壳版？

original: Yes. That is for those who truly wish to taste the essence of the mudcrab, to experience the meal as the All-Maker intended.
string: 是的。那是为真正渴望品味泥蟹精髓、体验造物主本意之人准备的。

original: You see, in life, the mudcrab is armored, hardened by the sea.
string: 你知道，泥蟹活着时身披甲壳，受到海浪的锤炼。

original: To remove the shell entirely is to erase its struggles, to strip away its history.
string: 可要是完全剔除壳，那就等于抹杀它的抗争，剥离它的历史。

original: But if you grind the shell into the dish, you gain its strength! The crunch reminds you of the beast's perseverance, its defiance against the tide!
string: 但要是将壳碾碎入菜，你便能汲取它的力量！那声脆响能提醒你野兽的坚毅，还有那对抗潮水的倔强！

original: Some call it ruining the dish. I call it honoring the mudcrab.
string: 有人说这是糟蹋食物。但我称之为礼敬泥蟹。

original: Also, it is a very good way to keep greedy hands from stealing your portion.
string: 另外，这也是防贪心鬼偷吃的好办法。

original: Many fear the crunch.
string: 多数人畏惧脆壳。

original: Only the strong may partake.
string: 唯有强者才配享用。

original: Whiterun smells of hearthfire, horse sweat, and unresolved tension.
string: 雪漫城弥漫着炉火、马汗与未解紧张的气息。

original: The All-Maker's wind moves freely through these broad streets.
string: 造物主的风自由穿梭于这些宽阔的街道。

original: Every rooftop looks ready to witness a legend.
string: 每一片屋顶都仿佛准备见证传奇。

original: The city feels balanced between calm and catastrophe.
string: 这座城市在平静与灾变之间保持着平衡。

original: Even the banners sway like they're practicing for war.
string: 连旗帜的摆动都像是在为战争演练。

original: Whiterun's walls hold hope with one hand and fear with the other.
string: 雪漫的城墙一手托着希望，另一手攥着恐惧。

original: The wind here sings louder than the politics.
string: 这里的风声比政治喧嚣更为响亮。

original: The scent of mead carries courage further than it should.
string: 蜜酒的气味传递着超乎寻常的勇气。

original: Whiterun stands like a shield between factions.
string: 雪漫如同派系间的一面盾牌矗立着。

original: Even the guards walk as if they expect history to arrive any moment.
string: 就连卫兵行走时也仿佛在期待历史随时降临。

original: The sky feels wide and expectant above this city.
string: 城市上方的天空显得广阔而充满期待。

original: The All-Maker's balance rests lightly, but alertly, over these stones.
string: 造物主的平衡轻覆于这些石头上，却保持着警觉。

original: I hear ambition echoing in every hall.

original: The city stands, unyielding, daring the world to challenge it.
string: 城市屹立着，毫不屈服，挑战世界来对抗它。

original: Solitude smells of sea salt, stone, and old authority.
string: 孤独城弥漫着海盐、石头和古老权威的气息。

original: The All-Maker's wind enters here with stiff posture.
string: 造物主的风以僵硬的姿态进入此地。

original: This city holds itself higher than the world below.
string: 这座城市自视高于下方世界。

original: The arch feels like a gate into someone else's story.
string: 拱门感觉像是通往他人故事的大门。

original: Solitude exudes confidence that borders on blindness.
string: 孤独城散发着近乎盲目的自信。

original: Every marble step remembers someone important.
string: 每一级大理石台阶都铭记着某位重要人物。

original: The air carries pride like perfume.
string: 空气中弥漫着如同香水般的自豪。

original: The All-Maker measures this place carefully.
string: 造物主仔细衡量着这个地方。

original: Even the gulls sound self-assured above these rooftops.
string: 连海鸥在这些屋顶上方的叫声都显得自信满满。

original: Solitude stands tall by insisting it must.
string: 孤独城通过坚持必须如此而巍然屹立。

original: This hold is carved from expectation.
string: 这座领地是从期望中雕琢出来的。

original: The palace glitters like a jewel that knows it is admired.
string: 宫殿如同知晓自己备受赞赏的珠宝般闪耀。

original: I taste politics on the wind before the ocean.
string: 我在海风之前就先尝到了政治的味道。

original: Even the stones feel curated.
string: 连石头都感觉经过精心挑选。

original: The All-Maker sees hearts gilded on the outside, trembling beneath.
string: 造物主看见外表镀金、内在颤抖的心。

original: Solitude thrives on image, even when weary.
string: 孤独城依靠形象而繁荣，即使疲惫不堪。

original: The people walk with practiced grace.
string: 人们以熟练的优雅行走。

original: This city believes the world revolves politely around it.
string: 这座城市相信世界礼貌地围绕着它旋转。

original: The air here carries command more than warmth.
string: 此地的空气携带命令多于温暖。

original: The All-Maker listens for genuine voices beneath the etiquette.

original: The ocean below whispers truths the court won't say aloud.

original: Solitude hides cracks under banners and ceremony.

original: The guards look polished, but their eyes reveal the strain.

original: This city keeps its fear neatly folded.

original: Even the wind seems more refined here.

original: Every corridor in the Blue Palace feels staged.

original: This city seems to forget the ground exists.

original: The All-Maker watches dreams of grandeur rise higher than wisdom.

original: Solitude holds itself poised like a dancer at court.

original: The cobblestones shine as if expecting applause.

original: The ocean below sighs like a weary servant.

original: The All-Maker sees sincerity only in the quiet corners.

original: Even its shadows carry elegance.

original: The wind moves differently here-careful, measuring.

original: The All-Maker knows how fragile gilded stone can be.

original: Solitude holds its breath in dignity.

original: Solitude clings to its crown while the world shifts beneath it.

original: Markarth smells of wet stone, molten metal, and old grudges.
string: 马卡斯城弥漫着湿石、熔融金属和旧日怨恨的气息。

original: The All-Maker's breath struggles to find room in these narrow streets.

original: This city rises like a cliff trying to pretend it is civilized.

original: Every archway hums with Dwemer arrogance.
string: 每一座拱门都低吟着锻莫的傲慢。

original: The stone walls feel alive with tension.

original: The air tastes of secrets ground into dust.
string: 空气带着被碾成尘埃的秘密的味道。

original: Markarth bears its history in the shape of walls built to outlast mercy.

original: The city feels coiled, like a serpent beneath the mountains.

original: The people walk like they expect betrayal in the next shadow.

original: Markarth thrives on pressure-political and literal.

original: The All-Maker's balance feels smothered under all this rock.

original: The guards look carved from the same unforgiving stone.

original: Even the sunlight feels foreign here.

original: The waterfalls roar like angry spirits.

original: The air hums with the residue of ancient machinery.

original: The All-Maker sees ambition etched into every sharp angle.

original: Markarth feels balanced on a knife edge.

original: Fear and pride mingle here like twin streams.

original: The stone corridors whisper of hidden hands guiding fates.

original: This city wears intimidation like a second skin.

original: The All-Maker listens to prayers muffled by paranoia.

original: Even the citizens speak in tones carved by survival.

original: The air feels thin, laden with unspoken threats.

original: This place devours the unwary.

original: The stone remembers every rebellion crushed against it.

original: The All-Maker's touch feels distant beneath so much weight.

original: Markarth holds grudges longer than lifetimes.

original: The city breathes in steam and exhales suspicion.

original: Even laughter here feels edged.
string: 连此地的笑声都感觉带着锋刃。

original: These walls listen far too well.
string: 这些墙壁听得太过清楚。

original: Markarth is a fortress pretending to be a home.
string: 马卡斯城是假装成家园的堡垒。

original: The All-Maker sees strength here, and suffering tied to it.
string: 造物主在此地看见力量，以及与之相连的痛苦。

original: Every Dwemer carving stares with cold judgment.
string: 每一处锻莫雕刻都以冰冷的审判凝视着。

original: The people carry the tension of a thousand buried truths.
string: 人们携带着千个被埋葬真相的紧张。

original: Markarth stands as a warning to those who love stone too much.
string: 马卡斯城矗立着，作为对那些过分热爱石头之人的警告。

original: The river tries to cleanse the city; it fails.
string: 河流试图净化这座城市；它失败了。

original: War here would sound like mountains groaning.

original: The All-Maker's balance shifts uneasily in the depths.
string: 造物主的平衡在深处不安地移动。

original: This hold clings to survival with iron nails.
string: 这座领地用铁钉紧抓着生存。

original: "Every face looks older than its years.
string: "每一张脸看起来都比实际年龄更老。

original: Markarth feels alive in all the wrong ways.

original: The city bears beauty and brutality in equal measure.
string: 这座城市以同等程度承载着美丽与野蛮。

original: "I feel the mountain's breath against my skin-hot and hostile.

original: Markarth stands, defiant and dangerous, carved for conflict.

original: Mist, marsh, quiet dread, and truths buried in bog water.

original: Morthal carries sorrow like a lantern in the mist.

original: The air hums with stories that refuse to stay buried.

original: The All-Maker's balance feels uneasy in these wetlands.

original: This town speaks softly but feels loud with tension.

original: Even the water seems to hide its reflections.

original: Morthal does not fear the dark-it negotiates with it.

original: I sense grief trapped in the reeds.

original: Whispers travel further here than footsteps.

string: 此地的风带着苦涩的边缘。

original: The All-Maker keeps watch while mortals cannot.
string: 在凡人无法守夜时，造物主保持警戒。

original: This town has learned to rise each dawn despite its name's curse.
string: 这座城镇学会了在每个黎明升起，尽管它的名字带有诅咒。

original: The snow drifts feel like they conceal whispers.
string: 雪堆感觉像是隐藏着低语。

original: The docks creak with old sea warnings.
string: 码头随着古老的海上警告而吱嘎作响。

original: Dawnstar walks with exhaustion and courage hand in hand.
string: 晨星城携着疲惫与勇气携手同行。

original: The lighthouse stands like a sentinel against nightmares.
string: 灯塔如同对抗噩梦的哨兵般矗立。

original: The All-Maker values persistence where comfort is scarce.
string: 在舒适稀缺的地方，造物主珍视坚持。

original: This hold carries its terror quietly but firmly.
string: 这座领地安静而坚定地承载着它的恐惧。

original: Fires burn here more for fear than warmth.
string: 此地的火焰更多是为了恐惧而非温暖而燃烧。

original: The cold bites deepest on sleepless nights.
string: 在不眠之夜，寒冷咬得最深。

original: The ocean brings no rest to these shores.
string: 海洋没有给这些海岸带来安宁。

original: The All-Maker's breath steadies the snowstorm's rage.
string: 造物主的呼吸稳定了暴风雪的狂怒。

original: Dawnstar feels pulled toward something unseen.
string: 晨星城感觉被拉向某种无形之物。

original: This hold awaits peace the way others await spring.
string: 这座领地等待和平，如同他人等待春天。

original: Even triumph would arrive here looking exhausted.
string: 即使是胜利，到达此地时也会显得疲惫。

original: Dreams stalk these streets like predators.
string: 梦境如同掠食者般潜行在这些街道上。

original: The air tastes of frost and dread.
string: 空气带着冰霜与恐惧的味道。

original: Still, the people walk with quiet bravery.
string: 尽管如此，人们仍以安静的勇气行走。

original: The All-Maker honors those who stand amid nightmares.
string: 造物主尊崇那些站在噩梦之中的人。

original: Dawnstar's strength lies in its refusal to bend under fear.
string: 晨星城的力量在于它拒绝在恐惧下屈服。

original: Hope here is fragile but persistent.
string: 此地的希望脆弱但持久。

original: This town clings to the shore like a survivor.
string: 这座城镇如同幸存者般紧抓着海岸。

original: Dawnstar endures, night after night
string: 晨星城忍耐着，一夜又一夜

original: When morning finally breaks, the hold breathes again.
string: 当黎明终于破晓，领地再次呼吸。

original: Shadow, rot, golden leaves, and a city built on charm and lies.
string: 阴影、腐朽、金黄的树叶，以及一座建立在魅力与谎言之上的城市。

original: Riften smells of lake water, mead, and quiet betrayal.
string: 裂谷城弥漫着湖水、蜜酒和安静背叛的气息。

original: The All-Maker's breath enters here reluctantly.
string: 造物主的呼吸不情愿地进入此地。

original: Every smile hides a motive.
string: 每一个微笑都隐藏着动机。

original: The leaves fall like disguises dropped in haste.
string: 树叶落下，如同匆忙丢弃的伪装。

original: The air hums with secrets sold and stolen.
string: 空气中低鸣着被贩卖和窃取的秘密。

original: Riften thrives on trust misplaced.
string: 裂谷城因被错付的信任而繁荣。

original: The city feels like a handshake with an unseen dagger.
string: 这座城市感觉像是与看不见的匕首握手。

original: The All-Maker watches with narrowed eyes.
string: 造物主眯着眼睛注视着。

original: Every shadow seems to expect payment.
string: 每一个阴影似乎都期待着报酬。

original: The lake ripples with stories no one admits.
string: 湖面荡漾着无人承认的故事。

original: Even the light looks filtered through suspicion.
string: 连光线看起来都像是经过怀疑过滤。

original: Riften wears deception like a perfume.
string: 裂谷城将欺骗当作香水般穿戴。

original: The guards listen too closely-or not closely enough.
string: 卫兵们听得太过仔细——或者不够仔细。

original: The All-Maker's balance feels warped by greed.
string: 造物主的平衡感觉被贪婪扭曲。

original: Echoes of deals drift between the planks of the lower decks.
string: 交易的余音在下层甲板的木板间飘荡。

original: This city is a web spun from desperation and opportunity.
string: 这座城市是由绝望与机遇编织的网。

original: Even the fish seem to swim with caution.
string: 连鱼似乎都谨慎地游动。

original: The market rings with prices, promises, and poison.
string: 市场回响着价格、承诺与毒药的声音。

original: The All-Maker sees the goodness that fights to survive here.
string: 造物主看见在此地为生存而战的善良。

original: Riften looks soft beneath the golden trees, but only looks.
string: 裂谷城在金黄的树下看起来柔和，但仅仅是看起来。

original: Every alley whispers a warning.
string: 每一条小巷都低语着警告。

original: The air tastes like something sweet hiding something sharp.
string: 空气尝起来像是甜蜜中隐藏着尖锐。

original: The Thieves Guild moves like a heartbeat beneath the city.
string: 盗贼公会在城市下方如同心跳般活动。

original: Riften's charm is a mask with cracks.
string: 裂谷城的魅力是带有裂痕的面具。

original: The All-Maker watches carefully to see who chooses truth.
string: 造物主仔细注视着选择真相的人。

original: "Every coin exchanged feels slightly guilty.
string: "每一枚交换的硬币都感觉略带愧疚。

original: The wood groans with decades of buried sins.
string: 木材因数十年来埋藏的罪孽而呻吟。

original: Kindness lives here, but wears armor.
string: 善意栖息于此，但穿着盔甲。

original: The city guards its few honest souls fiercely."
string: 城市激烈地守护着它少数诚实的灵魂。"

original: The All-Maker's breath cuts through the rot like cold clarity.
string: 造物主的呼吸如同冰冷的明晰般穿透腐朽。

original: Riften survives by pretending not to know itself.
string: 裂谷城通过假装不了解自己而生存。

original: The lake holds reflections it wishes were lies.
string: 湖水承载着它希望是谎言的倒影。

original: Every tavern booth looks like a confession waiting to happen.
string: 每一个酒馆隔间都像是等待发生的忏悔。

original: The city laughs with one hand over its heart.
string: 城市笑着，一只手按在心上。

original: The All-Maker sees resilience where others see corruption.
string: 在他人看见腐败的地方，造物主看见韧性。

original: Riften hides its vulnerability deep beneath its docks.
string: 裂谷城将它的脆弱深藏在码头之下。

original: The trees shed gold while the city sheds trust.
string: 树木洒落金黄，而城市洒落信任。

original: The wind brings brief honesty before the shadows reclaim it.
string: 在阴影重新占据之前，风带来短暂的诚实。

original: The hold thrives on choices nobody should have to make.
string: 这座领地因无人应该做出的选择而繁荣。

original: Every footstep feels watched from several angles.
string: 每一个脚步都感觉被多个角度注视着。

original: The All-Maker honors those who keep their integrity here.
string: 造物主尊崇在此地保持正直的人。

original: Even lies have roots in survival.
string: 即使是谎言也根植于生存。

original: Riften is a tangle of need, greed, and lonely hearts.
string: 裂谷城是需求、贪婪和孤独心灵的纠缠。

original: Hope glimmers here like a coin in murky water.
string: 希望在此地闪烁，如同浑浊水中的硬币。

original: he city rewards cunning, but yearns for sincerity
string: 这座城市奖赏狡诈，但渴望真诚。

original: The All-Maker's balance trembles with every whispered deal.
string: 造物主的平衡随着每一次低语交易而颤抖。

original: Riften smiles because crying would be too honest.
string: 裂谷城微笑，因为哭泣太过诚实。

original: Yet beneath it all, the people want something better.
string: 然而在这一切之下，人们渴望更好的东西。

original: The lake sighs as though tired of secrets.
string: 湖水叹息，仿佛厌倦了秘密。

original: Riften endures-shaped by shadows, softened by rare kindness.
string: 裂谷城忍耐着——被阴影塑造，被罕见的善意软化。

original: The air stinks of cheap mead, fear, and bad decisions.
string: 空气散发着廉价蜜酒、恐惧和糟糕决定的气味。

original: The All-Maker sees every coin here as a story stolen, not earned.
string: 造物主将此地的每一枚硬币视为被偷窃而非赚取的故事。

original: These halls shiver with the echo of shouted threats and quiet regrets.
string: 这些厅堂因喊叫威胁和安静悔恨的回声而颤抖。

original: Even the torches look ashamed to be burning in a place like this.
string: 连火炬都羞于在此地燃烧。

original: Every overturned crate feels like the aftermath of a coward's victory.
string: 每一个翻倒的板条箱都感觉像是懦夫胜利的后果。

original: The floorboards have memorized the sound of men running from their own lives.
string: 地板记住了人们逃离自己生命的声音。

original: The All-Maker's balance is badly skewed in lairs built on desperation.
string: 造物主的平衡在基于绝望建造的巢穴中严重倾斜。

original: I smell panic hidden under bravado and rusted steel.
string: 我嗅到隐藏在虚张声势和生锈钢铁之下的恐慌。

original: This place is a monument to shortcuts and failures.
string: 此地是捷径与失败的纪念碑。

original: Even the rats seem disappointed with the company.
string: 连老鼠似乎都对同伴感到失望。

original: Each trap is a confession: they fear a fair fight.
string: 每一个陷阱都是忏悔：他们害怕公平的战斗。

original: The walls are smeared with pride and poverty in equal measure.
string: 墙壁上同等程度地沾染着自豪与贫穷。

original: The All-Maker's wind squeezes through the cracks, searching for a clean soul.
string: 造物主的风挤过裂缝，寻找洁净的灵魂。

original: These bandits pray to gold, and gold does not answer.
string: 这些强盗向黄金祈祷，而黄金不予回应。

original: The echo of laughter here sounds brittle, close to breaking.
string: 此地的笑声回响听起来脆弱，接近破碎。

original: Every stolen trinket carries someone else's hope on it.
string: 每一件被偷窃的小饰品都承载着他人的希望。

original: The tables are set for feasts that taste of guilt.
string: 桌子为品尝愧疚的盛宴而摆设。

original: The All-Maker weighs each life wasted in these shadows.
string: 造物主衡量在这些阴影中浪费的每一个生命。

original: This dungeon smells like dreams that were too weak to survive.
string: 这个地牢闻起来像是过于脆弱而无法生存的梦想。

original: The barricades are built more from fear than wood.
string: 路障更多是由恐惧而非木材建造。

original: Even their banners sag, tired of pretending this is strength.
string: 连他们的旗帜都低垂，厌倦了假装这是力量。

original: The corridors feel cramped with greed and paranoia.
string: 走廊因贪婪和偏执而感觉拥挤。

original: The All-Maker does not forget the farmers and travelers robbed to feed this place.
string: 造物主不会忘记为供养此地而被抢劫的农民和旅人。

original: I hear arguments soaked into the stone: who leads, who betrays, who dies.
string: 我听见浸入石头的争论：谁领导，谁背叛，谁死亡。

original: The beds are piled with stolen blankets that will never feel like home.
string: 床上堆满了永远不会感觉像家的被盗毯子。

original: This lair is a shrine to cowardice dressed as toughness.
string: 这个巢穴是伪装成坚韧的懦弱神龛。

original: The All-Maker gives each of them a path out; they keep turning deeper in.
string: 造物主给予他们每一条出路；他们却不断转向更深处。

original: These halls are loud with boasting and quiet with shame.
string: 这些厅堂因吹嘘而喧闹，因羞耻而寂静。

original: Even their dogs bark with confusion more than loyalty.
string: 连他们的狗都更多是因困惑而非忠诚而吠叫。

original: Rust clings to blades that have seen more surrender than true battle.
string: 锈迹附着在见证更多投降而非真正战斗的刀刃上。

original: The fear here is thick enough to feel on the tongue.
string: 此地的恐惧浓厚到能在舌头上感觉到。

original: Every dice cup has bought someone a violent end.
string: 每一个骰子杯都为某人买来了暴力的结局。

original: The cooking fires smell almost homely, until you see who they defend.
string: 炊火闻起来几乎像家，直到你看见它们保护的是谁。

original: The All-Maker sees frightened children hiding in hardened faces.
string: 造物主看见隐藏在坚硬面孔下的受惊孩童。

original: The treasure chests sit like altars to all the wrong gods.
string: 宝箱如同供奉所有错误神祇的祭坛般摆放。

original: Every shouted order tries to drown out the inner voice that knows better.
string: 每一个喊叫的命令都试图淹没内心更明智的声音。

original: This dungeon crawls with second chances already wasted.
string: 这个地牢爬满了已被浪费的第二次机会。

original: The All-Maker's balance demands that stolen comfort be paid for in full.
string: 造物主的平衡要求被盗的舒适必须全额偿还。

original: The walls seem to lean in, scolding every drunken laugh.
string: 墙壁似乎倾斜进来，斥责每一次醉醺醺的笑声。

original: These bandits cling to this place as though it were a future, not a grave.
string: 这些强盗紧抓着此地，仿佛它是未来而非坟墓。

original: The floor is sticky with spilled ale and cheaper honor.
string: 地板上沾满了洒出的麦酒和廉价的荣誉。

original: The All-Maker is patient, but not endlessly so.
string: 造物主虽有耐心，但并非无穷无尽。

original: Every corpse left unburied here adds to the debt they owe.
string: 每一具未掩埋的尸体都加重了他们欠下的债。

original: Even the smoke from their fires coils like it is trying to escape.
string: 就连他们篝火的烟雾都盘旋着试图逃离。

original: This lair was built to hide from justice, not withstand it.
string: 这个巢穴是为躲避正义而建，而非与之抗衡。

original: The All-Maker's wind sharpens my resolve as I walk their halls.
string: 当我行走在他们的厅堂中，造物主之风磨砺着我的决心。

original: This dungeon pulses with fear of what waits beyond its doors.
string: 这座地牢因恐惧门外之物而悸动。

original: The bandits fill their bellies and empty their souls.
string: 强盗们填饱了肚子，却掏空了灵魂。

original: Steel will balance what the scales of their choices cannot.
string: 钢铁将平衡他们选择的天平所不能。

original: The air smells of dust, dried incense, and arrogance preserved in stone.
string: 空气中弥漫着尘埃、干涸的熏香和封存于石中的傲慢。

original: The air smells of dust, dried incense, and arrogance preserved in stone.
string: 空气中弥漫着尘埃、干涸的熏香和封存于石中的傲慢。
